intro: Gutierrezia divaricata, commonly known as brittlebrush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gutierrezia divaricata is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
